customer_name: R M R S MANUFACTURING & DISTRIBUTING INC
site_name: R M R S MANUFACTURING & DISTRIBUTING INC

citations.narrative:
Two puppies, housed in individual enclosures within the nursery, are not being provided the minimum floor space as
required by the Animal Welfare Act.
Two female golden retriever puppies (ID#s 7539 and 7540) are each housed in a medium sized enclosure which
measures 20.5 inches by 26 inches (533 square inches). Both puppies measured 20.5 inches in length, requiring 702.25
sq. inches of space (20.5” + 6” = (26.5 in)2 = 702.25 in2) but only provided 533 sq. inches.
Failing to provide adequate space can cause discomfort, crowding, poor sanitation, increased incidence of illness, and
lead to developmental abnormalities especially in larger breed dogs.
Correct by January 26, 2023 by ensuring that all dogs are provided with at least the minimum space required by the
Animal Welfare Act. The facility took measures to correct the noncompliance during the inspection.

A male Pomeranian/Klee Kai puppy housed in a temporary enclosure on the sales floor is not being provided the
minimum interior height as required by the Animal Welfare Act.
The puppy (ID# 3711) has only 3-4 inches of clearance between the top of his head and the top of the enclosure when
sitting/standing. All dogs require a minimum of 6 inches of clearance above the top of their heads.
Failing to provide adequate head space in a primary enclosure prevents normal postural adjustments, including stretching
the neck up and can lead to discomfort and potential developmental abnormalities.
Correct by January 26, 2023 by ensuring that all dogs are provided with at least the minimum space required by the
Animal Welfare Act. The facility took measures to correct the noncompliance during the inspection.
The inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
Additional Inspectors:
Lauren Murphy, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICEREnd Section

narrative:
3.6(c)(1)(i) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
Two puppies, housed in individual enclosures within the nursery, are not being provided the minimum floor space as 
required by the Animal Welfare Act. 
Two female golden retriever puppies (ID#s 7539 and 7540) are each housed in a medium sized enclosure which 
measures 20.5 inches by 26 inches (533 square inches). Both puppies measured 20.5 inches in length, requiring 702.25 
sq. inches of space (20.5” + 6” = (26.5 in)2 = 702.25 in2) but only provided 533 sq. inches.  
Failing to provide adequate space can cause discomfort, crowding, poor sanitation, increased incidence of illness, and 
lead to developmental abnormalities especially in larger breed dogs.  
Correct by January 26, 2023 by ensuring that all dogs are provided with at least the minimum space required by the 
Animal Welfare Act. The facility took measures to correct the noncompliance during the inspection. 
3.6(c)(1)(iii) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
A male Pomeranian/Klee Kai puppy housed in a temporary enclosure on the sales floor is not being provided the 
minimum interior height as required by the Animal Welfare Act.  
The puppy (ID# 3711) has only 3-4 inches of clearance between the top of his head and the top of the enclosure when

sitting/standing. All dogs require a minimum of 6 inches of clearance above the top of their heads.   
Failing to provide adequate head space in a primary enclosure prevents normal postural adjustments, including stretching 
the neck up and can lead to discomfort and potential developmental abnormalities.  
Correct by January 26, 2023 by ensuring that all dogs are provided with at least the minimum space required by the 
Animal Welfare Act. The facility took measures to correct the noncompliance during the inspection. 
 
The inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Lauren Murphy, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICEREnd Section
